did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Nan Britton Papers,

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of California, Los Angeles. Library. Department of Special Collections.

did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. Please contact the UCLA Library, Department of Special Collections Reference Desk for paging information.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical object belong to the UCLA Library, Department of Special Collections. Literary rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: PARTIALLY PROCESSED COLLECTION UNAVAILABLE FOR USE: Inquiries regarding these materials should be directed, in writing, to the Manuscripts Librarian, UCLA Department of Special Collections.
COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Advance notice required for access.

altformavail.head: Additional Physical Form Available
altformavail.p: A copy of the original version of this online finding aid is available at the UCLA Department of Special Collections for in-house consultation and may be obtained for a fee. Please contact:

list.item: UCLA Library, Department of Special Collections
Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Nan Britton Papers (Collection 467). Department of Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of correspondence, manuscripts, clippings, photographs, and memorabilia.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: Women authors, American--Archival resources.

Documentary Files
Letter from Warren G. Harding to Nan Britton, [1917] May 9.

note.p: Written on U.S. Senate stationery (with envelope). 3pp.

did.unittitle: Letter from Warren G. Harding to Nan Britton, May 15, 1917.

note.p: Written on Senate Chamber stationery, 4pp. (2 leaves).

did.unittitle: Letter from Warren G. Harding to Nan Britton, August 11, 1917.

note.p: Written on U.S. Senate stationery, 1 leaf.

did.unittitle: Letter from Warren G. Harding to Nan Britton, May 25, 1918.

note.p: Written on U.S. Senate, Committee on Commerce stationery, 2pp. with franked envelope.

did.unittitle: Letter from Warren G. Harding to Nan Britton, December 5, 1918.

note.p: Written on U.S. Senate, Committee on Commerce stationery, 1-1/2 pages, no envelope.

did.unittitle: Letter from Warren G. Harding to Dr. Frank T. Spaulding, Superintendent of Public Schools, Cleveland , Ohio, May 25, 1918.

note.p: Regarding my mother's changing her position as teacher. Letter of May 25, 1918 (above) sent to me same date.

did.unittitle: Carbon copy of letter from Nan Britton to Warren G. Harding, May 7, 1917.

note.p: Sent to him at Washington, D.C., to which he replied under date of May 9. Attached ia copy of carbon re-typed for clarity.

did.unittitle: Carbon copy of letter from Nan Britton to Warren G. Harding, May 11, 1917.

note.p: ... in reply to his letter of me of May 9; also re-typed for clarity.

did.unittitle: Letter to Nan Britton from her mother November 1, 1926.

note.p: ... regarding the latter's misplacement of a letter written by Senator Harding to Mark Thompson, who was also with the Cleveland Public Schools as President of the Board of Education.... With envelope.

note.p: Mr. Votaw had returned to me my 'Action to Annual a Marriage' which I had sent him to view, but he sent it back without any comment or note.

note.p: With envelope. Nan Britton's note: containing a cashier's check for $25.00.

note.p: Nan Britton's note: ... accompanied a little gift to me back in my high school days ...

note.p: Sent to Nan Britton in care of a friend.

did.unittitle: Letter from Pris to Nan Britton, March 16, 1927.
Letter from Nan Britton to Gen. Charles E. Dawes (carbon copy), May 15, 1926.

note.p: Nan Britton's note: See The President's Daughter, episode no.166, p.379 re this.

did.unittitle: Photograph of Warren G. Harding inscribed To Miss Nan Britton ... Sincerely, Warren G. Harding. n.d.
Photograph of Miss Abigail Victoria Harding (later Mrs. Ralph T. Lewis) inscribed: Most sincerely yours, Abigail Victoria Harding. n.d.
Photograph of Carolyn Harding (Mrs. Heber Herbert Votaw, inscribed: Yours truly, Carolyn Votaw. n.d.
Photograph of Dr. George Tryon Harding, father fo Warren G. Harding, Victoria and Carolyn Harding, inscribed: Yours truly, G.T. Harding. n.d.
Photograph of Lila Wesener, inscribed : To Miss Nan Britton -- / With and all good wishes from / her admiring friend, ' Lila Wesener. n.d.

note.p: Nan Britton's note The latter inscription was cut from the photograph because I wanted to frame the latter 'close-up' but I kept the inscription. Lila Wesener was a cousin of the Harding sisters and brothers.

did.unittitle: Wallet of Warren G. Harding, n.d.

note.p: Nan Britton's note: ... (his name imprinted in gold), given to me by Carrie Votaw when I was a guest in their home in Tacoma Park, Washington, D.C. (see p.308, The President's Daughter).

did.unittitle: Notarized statement of Mrs. Mary Lee Britton (Nan Britton's mother) regarding a visit of Elizabeth Britton Willits (Nan Brittons sister) to Mr. Harding at Marion, Ohio, after the election, August 4, 1928.
Statement from Nan Britton's sister, Elizabeth Britton Willits, regarding her knowledge of Nan Britton's receipt of letters from Mr. Harding, January 4, 1960.
Letter from Mrs. Jack (Mary) Pusey regarding her suspicions of Mr. Harding's paternity and Nan Britton's reply (carbon copy), December 31, 1931 and January 2, 1932.

note.p: Dated per envelope. Mrs. Pusey called Mrs. P.J. Johnson in The President's Daughter. Nan Britton's note: I resided in the home (apartment) of the Puseys for two years during which time I was seeing Mr. Harding.

did.unittitle: Snapshot of Warren G. Harding which Nan Britton loved and carried for years. n.d.

note.p: Nan Britton's additional note: This one is in The President's Daughter, opposite p.60. (Snapshot sent to me by Warren G. Harding).

did.unittitle: Another Snapshot of Warren G. Harding which Nan Britton loved and carried almost as long as the one above. n.d.

note.p: Nan Britton's note: (This one acquired I don't recall how. It appears to have been taken at the White House).

did.unittitle: Snapshot of Nan Britton, Harding booster in the pre-election days of 1920. 1920.
Photograph of Mr. Harding taken at Edmonston Studio, Washington, D.C, n.d.

note.p: Nan Britton's note: This was the first photograph Mr. Harding sent me - when I lived at 412 E. 58th St., New York City, with my father's college classmate's family (Mr. Mrs. Grove D. Curtis and daughter Anna), in the spring of 1917.

did.unittitle: Newspaper picture of Abigail and Carolyn, 1920.
Photograph of Warren G. Harding by Pach, 1920.

note.p: Nan Britton's note: ... displayed in the Pach Fifth Avenue window in August of 1923. Returning from France on learning of Mr. Harding's death, I chanced to see it and bought this copy.

did.unittitle: Letter from the Ithaca Conservatory of Music to Scott Willits (Nan Britton's brother-in-law), part of letter from Elizabeth Willits and Nan Britton's note re this letter, December 18, 1920.

note.p: Nan Britton's note: I took this letter with me when I met Mr. Harding at the Statler Hotel in Cleveland ... , see p.143 - Ep. 58, The President's Daughter.

did.unittitle: Letter from Governor James M. Cox of Ohio to Nan Britton, June 28, 1918.

note.p: Nan Brittons note: ... offering to assist my brother find a suitable position. My brother never used the letter ... see p.161, episode 64 in The President's Daughter.

did.unittitle: Glossy print of a photograph of President Harding and full-length snapshot of Elizabeth Ann Harding - The Likeness. n.d.
Photo of Elizabeth Ann with her Harding book. June 1921.

note.p: Nan Britton's note: ... taken in back yard of my sister E's apartment on La Fayette Parkway, Chgo ...

did.unittitle: Photo of Nan Britton holding Elizabeth Ann, September 1920.

note.p: Nan Britton's note: Taken in front of apt. house where lived the nurse who took care of E.A. for over a year.

did.unittitle: Pressed flower from President Harding's desk in the White House, June 1921.

note.p: Nan Britton's note: See episode 62, p.156 [The President's Daughter].

did.unittitle: Page from The Marion Daily Star containing a photograph of Nan Britton at age 5, February 1, 1902.
Remaining empty pages of diary kept by Nan Britton, n.d.

note.p: Nan Britton's note: ... the written pages torn out and destroyed at the request of Mr. Harding to my sister Elizabeth who confided to him that I was keeping the diary.

did.unittitle: Facsimile of registration of G.H. Harvey wife, Cleveland, at the Imperial Hotel, New York, n.d.

note.p: Nan Britton's note: ... facsimile of Mr. Harding's registering of us ...

did.unittitle: Draft of The President's Daughter, with editorial markings, n.d.

note.p: Nan Britton's note: ... My carbon copy was subsequently destroyed by me. Also, because of very personal allusions in my statement for Mr. Ashley, the original 'legal' manuscript, writeen for the attorney, was destroyed by me.

did.unittitle: Draft of Honesty or Politics (original title Stony Limits), n.d.

note.p: Nan Britton's note: ... many passages were cut out at the suggestion of the critic who viewed it. (Clifton Fadiman)

did.unittitle: Letter from Lillian Knell to Nan Britton with clippings re Warren G. Harding, June 19, 1926.

note.p: Lillian Knell was the niece of Mrs. Jack (Mary) Pusey.

did.unittitle: School report of Elizabeth Ann Harding (Willits) which appears in The President's Daughter, opposite p.280, June 4, 1925.
Letter (carbon copy) from Nan Britton to the New York Times re permission to use Nan Britton's poem The child's eyes in a forthcoming book and their reply, January 20, January 26, 1920.

note.p: With facsimile of Nan Britton's first check received for the sale of any writing and a clipping of The Times, August 30, 1926 with the printed poem.

did.unittitle: Letter from Helen Evans to Nan Britton and Nan Britton's reply (carbon copy), November 3 November 5, 1927.

note.p: Helen Evans was Nan Britton's nurse at the time Elizabeth Ann was born.

did.unittitle: Telegram from Nan Britton to Mrs. Elizabeth Willits re President Harding's death, August 3, 1923.

note.p: Nan Britton's note: Elizabeth, her husband and Elizabeth Ann were visiting Scott Willits' mother and father at the time, at their country home near Keithsburg, Illinois.

did.unittitle: Postcards of The Claypool Hotel, McFarland Hotel, and Witherill Hotel n.d.

note.p: Nan Britton's note: See The President's Daughter, pp.37-39 and 57-60 where these are mentioned.

did.unittitle: Bankbooks. 4 items, 1919-1921.

note.p: Nan Britton's note: ... monies given to me by Mr. Harding ...

did.unittitle: Campaign poster likeness of President Harding which hung on Nan Britton's bedroom wall, n.d.

note.p: Reproduced in The President's Daughter, p.12.

did.unittitle: Letter from Elizabeth Ann to her mother Nan Britton, 1926.

note.p: Nan Britton's note: ... (written when she was in 2nd grade ina a Chicago public school). Reproduced in The President's Daughter, p.372.

did.unittitle: High school senior oration by Nan Britton, notations by Abigail Harding, 1914.
The autobiography of me by Nan Britton, 1921.

note.p: Written for a class assignment at Columbia University.

did.unittitle: Today's Health, with A day with Papa by Nan Britton, pp.30-33, 90-91, February 1966.

note.p: Based on a brief sketch in The autobiography of me.

did.unittitle: At the keyhole of the Cabinet Room, New York Times, June 5, 1921.

note.p: With photocopy. Nan Britton's note: See p.155, 1st paragraph, The President's Daughter.

Photographs of Warren G. Harding. 2 items, n.d.

note.p: See opposite p. 173, The President's Daughter.

did.unittitle: Photograph of Warren G. Harding, n.d.

note.p: Copyright by Edmonston Studio, Washington, D.C. Note by Nan Britton: Reprints of other photos or pictures appearing opposite pp.129, 134, 160, 180, 204 in The President's Daughter are in my 'Harding scrapbook.'

did.unittitle: Manuscript for French translation by Louis Postif of The President's Daughter, n.d.
Letter from Harry Winfield Saxton to the Editor of the Boston Post, October 29, 1927.

note.p: Saxton was a member of the Armstrong tour, the group Nan Britton traveled with to Dijon in the summer of 1923. See episode 103, pp.248-249 in The President's Daughter.

did.unittitle: Letter from Elizabeth Ann to her mother, Nan Britton, September 21, 1927.

note.p: See opposite p. 340 in The President's Daughter.

did.unittitle: Correspondence of Addison B. Colvin, 1930-1931.
Letters re opening of Nan Britton's mail by the Post Office, 1930, 1932, 1933.

note.p: Letter from William Marsteller, November 1, 1930, Nan Britton, October 30, 1930, Nathan Loeser, October 31, 1930, Jessie Conley, March 17, 1932 and Nan Britton's reply, May 3, 1932. 2 letters from Nan Britton's mother, February 1, 1930 and Fall 1930.

did.unittitle: Letter from office of F.E. Scobey to Nan Britton and Nan Britton's reply and related clipping, September 8 12, 1924.

note.p: Clipping is about the death of Frank E. Scobey, 1931.

did.unittitle: Affidavit of Mrs. Marietta Tonnesen, November 16, 1926.
